org.liris.smartgov.simulator.core.simulation.time

Class Date

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.liris.smartgov.simulator.core.simulation.time.Time
      • org.liris.smartgov.simulator.core.simulation.time.Date
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Time>

    public class Date
extends Time
    A fixed time class, that cannot be incremented.

        public Date(Date origin,
            int day,
            int hour,
            int minutes)
        Build a new date from the specified origin. The origin is just used to compute the good week day.
        Parameters:
        origin - used to compute the corresponding week day
        day - days counts
        hour - hours count
        minutes - minutes count

    • Method Detail

      • after

        public Date after(int days,
                  int hours,
                  int minutes,
                  int seconds)
        Returns a new date incremented from this date by the specified amount of time.

        Each value can be in any range.

        Parameters:
        days - days to add
        hours - hours to add
        minutes - minutes to add
        seconds - seconds to add
        Returns:
        new incremented date

      • afterDay

        public Date afterDay(int days)
        Returns a new date incremented from this date by the specified days count.
        Parameters:
        days - days to add
        Returns:
        new incremented date

      • afterHour

        public Date afterHour(int hours,
                      int minutes)
        Returns a new date incremented from this date by the specified amounts of hours and minutes.

        Each value can be in any range.

        Parameters:
        hours - hours to add
        minutes - minutes to add
        Returns:
        new incremented hour

      • at

        public Date at(int hour,
               int minutes)
        Returns the date of the same day at the specified time. The specified time must be after this date hour.
        Parameters:
        hour - hour in [0, 24[
        minutes - minutes in [0, 60[
        Returns:
        corresponding date of the same day
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if hours or minutes are not in a valid range, or if the specified date is anterior to this date.

      • next

        public Date next(WeekDay weekDay)
        Returns a new date that correspond to the next specified week day. If the weekDay is the same as the current week day, returns the same day of the next week.
        Parameters:
        weekDay - next week day
        Returns:
        new date corresponding to the specified week day

      • copy

        public Date copy()
        Returns a new Date instance with the same values as this date
        Returns:
        this date copy
